intro: Tarenaya diffusa, commonly known as the silver leaf tree, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery down. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Tarenaya diffusa is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and floral display. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight.
